name: denomination

denomination noun
(RELIGIOUS GROUP)
Add to word list
Add to word list
[ C, + sing/pl verb ] a religious group that has slightly different beliefs from other groups that share the same religion: Protestantism and Roman Catholicism are both denominations of the Christian faith.
More examplesFewer examplesEven the most conservative denominations have now accepted some of these principles.This is not in the traditions of any Christian denomination.The Reform movement is the largest of the Jewish denominations.

denomination noun
(VALUE)
[ C ] a unit of value, especially of money: It always takes time to get used to the different denominations of coins when you go to a foreign country.
More examplesFewer examplesCoins come in denominations of 1p, 2p, 5p, 10p, 20p, 50p and £1 and £2.They would no longer accept banknotes of certain denominations.It's useful to have a few small denomination coins and notes.The stamps come in various denominations.

denomination noun
(NAME)
[ C ] formal a particular name for something or someone: The correct denomination for the crime is "aggravated murder".
More examplesFewer examplesAlzheimer's disease was first written about in 1906 and by 1910, this denomination for the condition was well established among specialists."Astronaut" seems a rather hypberbolic denomination for someone who has barely left his home planet.They object to the use of any denomination that implies a territorial claim.
